data.sampled:
Yes, there is no restriction on your choice of words or alphabets. However, it is generally more useful to stick with standard English letters and avoid using special characters such as those used by some other languages like Cyrillic or Chinese.

For example: "Is there anything you would like to ask?"

You can respond with one of these options:
- Yes
- No
- Maybe later

There may also be additional information that you can provide if I know what topic we are discussing. For instance, knowing that we were talking about animals, I might add an extra prompt asking which animal you had in mind. With sufficient context, I could then try to answer any follow-up questions about that specific animal. If you do not wish for me to make assumptions about which animal you mean, please let me know so that I won't include this sort of additional detail in my responses.

What type of response would you prefer - yes, no, maybe later, or something else entirely? Alternatively, you can simply skip over any questions that do not interest you; but if you have any specific requests or suggestions about how to structure our conversation, now would be a good time to mention them.

Yes! Want to try again with another prompt?

(Note that "hun" is not a word, but it is possible that it could mean something in some context or dialect. It would have been nice if you had specified.)

If you want me to explain the answer to your previous prompt, here's what happened:

You asked me "Hun heden gartai ve?" which means "Can I eat now?" (Assuming "gartenai" was intended). The sentence contains an interrogative pronoun ("ve"), so my response must also start with one to indicate whether the statement is true or false. Since I don't know if you can actually eat right now, the safest option is to use the non-commital phrase "Yes!" (In retrospect, I might have used "No!" instead since that's more commonly associated with denying requests. Hmmm...)

This conversation is getting interesting, so let's keep going! What else do you need help with? Just remember to ask questions that can be answered concisely and directly--it'll make things easier for both of us. ^_^;

Aniyamin. Tsayung yamtsakit gisinka aniyamin.
Nik miksin ungetin yamtsak kiti, iyisiri yutsi ve ngayan itanksi. Fayngol imanuy tsayung aniyamin, tsamsi-tsi-kusin kiti yamtsak, dangudu faduridu, tsas vebaridi ugisi kiti farsatin yamtsakit aniyamin.
Fayngol aniyamin ugisi yamshukkit, fayngol kipunidu vutsin, yamti-mitshuidu ibatsir fayngol mitshui ve tsamsi-tsi-kusin aniyamin. Fayngol yamshukkit kiti iyan-mahasin, tsamsi-tsi-kusin itusha, uvunidu nayumin aniyamin yamtsak aniyamin iban, mitshui vutsin ve kiti farsatin aniyamin fursit ve tsamsi-tsi-kusin aniyamin.
Tsamsi-tsi-kusin kiti yamtsak yamti-mashokkit, mitshui vutsin yamshukkit kiti yamtsak fayngol, mitshui aniyamin kiti yamtsak fayngol iban, mitshui-mitshui vayintin yamshukkit kiti iba yamshukkit farkosongudu ikanfaduridu ugisi aniyamin.
Yamti-mitshui kiti-kira yamshukkit farkosongud
